intro: Fischeria heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf fisher's grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its distinctive foliage. The plant exhibits heterophyllous traits, meaning it has leaves of different shapes and sizes depending on environmental conditions. Its flowering stems produce small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Fischeria heterophylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
